Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the school shooting in Arapahoe County, Colorado, was not actually circumvented by an armed school resource officer. The shooter was not stopped by the officer but died by his own hand.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of the armed school resource officer by suggesting that the shooting was completely prevented, when in reality, the shooter was able to harm and kill a student.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the assertion that an armed school resource officer prevented the shooting.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that having an armed school resource officer present would always be sufficient to prevent a school shooting, which is not necessarily the case.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations or factors that may have contributed to the outcome of the shooting, such as the shooter's own actions or mental state.
